projectGridLines.title: Title: Product Management (Bengaluru )
projectGridLines.description:
Title: Product Management (Bengaluru )

Description:

Join us at Qure.ai Technologies, one of the world’s most widely deployed AI software in the healthcare

sector. As a Product Management Intern, immerse yourself in the dynamic interplay of cutting-edge

artificial intelligence and medical innovation. Work collaboratively with an interdisciplinary team of

product managers, medical professionals, and AI researchers. Contribute to projects that encompass

market research, mapping user experience, defining criteria for AI model development, and publishing

research papers.

Skill sets:

• Analytical thinking and data interpretation

• Familiarity with AI concepts (a plus, but not mandatory as fundamental principles will be

covered in orientation)

• Effective communication and presentation skills

• Proficiency in tools like JIRA, Figma and Chat GPT

• Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams like Engineering, Design, AI R&D, Clinical

Research, Regulatory, Marketing and Customer Support

• An ideal candidate would be a versatile generalist, adept at wearing multiple hats, navigating

between diverse functions, and bridging gaps in a dynamic, AI-driven healthcare landscape.

Expected learning:

1. AI in Healthcare: Understand the intricacies of integrating artificial intelligence in healthcare,

its challenges, and its transformative potential.

2. User-Centered Design: Dive deep into user research and understanding user journeys to

build products that resonate with the end user.

3. Strategic Roadmapping: Understand how to prioritize features, set product goals, and

develop a strategic roadmap in alignment with business objectives.

4. Go-to-Market Strategies: Gain insights into launching products in the market, understanding

positioning, pricing, and promotion strategies.

5. Feedback Loop Creation: Learn the art of collecting feedback, iterating on the product, and

continuously improving to meet market demands.

Specific courses required for project execution: None
